problem.p: Below is a graph of the function \(y(x) =\sin(x)\). Your goal is to find the first positive zero of this function using Newton's method. Recall that Newton's method is an iterative approach to finding the zeros of a function using tangent line approximations.
Starting from an initial guess \(x_0=0.5\), draw the first two tangent lines used in Newton's method and determine the next two approximations for the root.
